intro: Tetrorchidium molinae, commonly known as the Molina's tetrorchid, is a rare flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, such as cloud forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
